Class com.penthera.virtuososdk.Common.Events
Inherited members: ShowHide
Deprecated: ShowHide
com.penthera.virtuososdk

Class Common.Events

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.penthera.virtuososdk.Common.Events
  • Enclosing class:
    Common
    public static final class Common.Events extends java.lang.Object
    Identifies Virtuoso's Events, meaning "things that gets reported to the Backplane." Provides helper methods for instantiating Events that Virtuoso reports.

      addAppLaunchEvent 
      static boolean addAppLaunchEvent(android.content.Context context)
      Creates and automatically saves an App-Launch Event using the provided Context.
      public static boolean addAppLaunchEvent(android.content.Context context)
      Creates and automatically saves an App-Launch Event using the provided Context.
      Parameters:
      context - Context to use when saving the event
      Returns:
      True if the event was successfully saved
      addCustomEvent 
      static boolean addCustomEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String aName, java.lang.String assetId, long data)
      Creates and automatically saves a Custom Event using the provided Context.
      public static boolean addCustomEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String aName, java.lang.String assetId, long data)
      Creates and automatically saves a Custom Event using the provided Context. The Custom Event allows you to create arbitrarily named events and record these events on the Backplane along with the Virtuoso built-in events. This method version takes a long data argument. To send text event data, use the customEvent method.
      Parameters:
      context - Context to use when saving the event
      aName - Name for this custom Event
      assetId - Externally-defined ID for the asset
      data - Data to be associated with this Event
      Returns:
      True if the event was successfully saved
      addCustomEvent 
      static boolean addCustomEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String aName, java.lang.String assetId, java.lang.String data)
      Creates and automatically saves a Custom Event using the provided Context.
      public static boolean addCustomEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String aName, java.lang.String assetId, java.lang.String data)
      Creates and automatically saves a Custom Event using the provided Context. The Custom Event allows you to create arbitrarily named events and record these events on the Backplane along with the Virtuoso built-in events. This method version takes a String data argument. To send numeric event data, use the customEvent method.
      Parameters:
      context - Context to use when saving the event
      aName - Name for this custom Event
      assetId - Externally-defined ID for the asset
      data - Data to be associated with this Event
      Returns:
      True if the event was successfully saved.
      addPlayStartEvent 
      static boolean addPlayStartEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String assetId)

      Creates and automatically saves a Play-Start Event using the provided Context.
      Parameters:
      context - Context to use when saving the event
      assetId - Externally-defined ID for the asset

      addPlayStopEvent 
      static boolean addPlayStopEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String assetId, long secondsPlayed)
      Creates and automatically saves a Play-Stop Event using the provided Context.
      public static boolean addPlayStopEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String assetId, long secondsPlayed)
      Creates and automatically saves a Play-Stop Event using the provided Context.
      Parameters:
      context - The context to use when saving the event
      assetId - The externally defined ID representing the Asset
      secondsPlayed - The amount of time the Asset was played, since the last Play Start Event, in seconds.
      Returns:
      True if the event was successfully saved
      enableAllEvents 
      static void enableAllEvents(android.content.Context context, boolean enable)
      Enables or disables reporting of all SDK events.
      public static void enableAllEvents(android.content.Context context, boolean enable)
      Enables or disables reporting of all SDK events.
      Parameters:
      context - Context to use
      enable - Indicates whether to enable or disable all events
      enableEvent 
      static boolean enableEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String eventName, boolean enable)
      Enables or disables reporting of a particular SDK event.
      public static boolean enableEvent(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String eventName, boolean enable)
      Enables or disables reporting of a particular SDK event.
      Parameters:
      context - Context to use
      eventName - The event to enable/disable
      enable - Indicates whether to enable or disable the event
      Returns:
      The final enabled state of the event, which may differ from the requested state
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the event being enabled is not an SDK event.
      isEventEnabled 
      static boolean isEventEnabled(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String eventName)
      Returns the current enabled state of the indicated SDK event.
      public static boolean isEventEnabled(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String eventName)
      Returns the current enabled state of the indicated SDK event.
      Parameters:
      context - Context to use
      eventName - The event name
      Returns:
      Whether or not the event is enabled
